intro: Pasania yungjenensis, commonly known as the Yungjen mountain holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, particularly in Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in white or pale pink. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
